com.example.mdbook

Class UserManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.example.mdbook.UserManager

  • public class UserManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides a singleton interface for managing users, user data and user login / logout. Brings together the controllers for local storage, cache storage and cloud storage for managing data. Based (loosely) off the StudentListManager in the student-picker app by Abram Hindle https://github.com/abramhindle/student-picker
    See Also:
    UserController, ElasticsearchController, LocalStorageController, DataManager

      • getManager

        public static UserManager getManager()
        Auto initializes if not already done
        Returns:
        Singleton instance of self.

      • createPatient

        public void createPatient(java.lang.String userID,
                          java.lang.String userPhone,
                          java.lang.String userEmail)
                   throws UserIDNotAvailableException,
                          java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                          android.accounts.NetworkErrorException
        Create new patient profile and save.
        Parameters:
        userID - The unique ID of the new patient. Must be unique.
        userPhone - The phone number of the new patient.
        userEmail - The email of the new patient.
        Throws:
        UserIDNotAvailableException - Thrown if the userID is not unique
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if the userID is less than 8 characters
        android.accounts.NetworkErrorException - Thrown if there were any network issues creating the user (e.g no internet)

      • createCaregiver

        public void createCaregiver(java.lang.String userID,
                            java.lang.String userPhone,
                            java.lang.String userEmail)
                     throws UserIDNotAvailableException,
                            java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                            android.accounts.NetworkErrorException
        Create new caregiver profile and save.
        Parameters:
        userID - The unique ID of the new caregiver. Must be unique.
        userPhone - The phone number of the new caregiver.
        userEmail - The email of the new caregiver.
        Throws:
        UserIDNotAvailableException - Thrown if the userID is not unique
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if the userID is less than 8 characters
        android.accounts.NetworkErrorException - Thrown if there were any network issues creating the user

      • login

        public boolean login(java.lang.String userid)
              throws android.accounts.NetworkErrorException
        Verify user exists and login credentials are valid. Loads user into UserController on success.
        Parameters:
        userid - The userID of the user trying to log in.
        Returns:
        Returns true on successful login, false if credentials are invalid, user doesn't exist or there is already someone logged in.
        Throws:
        android.accounts.NetworkErrorException

      • localLogin

        public boolean localLogin()
        Attempt to login based on local data.
        Returns:
        True if there is a local copy of user data and login based on that was successful.

      • logout

        public void logout()
        Clears all data out of cache and local storage.

      • fetchUser

        public User fetchUser(java.lang.String userID)
               throws NoSuchUserException,
                      android.accounts.NetworkErrorException
        Builds full user object for the given userID from database. Returns said user object. Does not load into UserController
        Parameters:
        userID - The userID of the user to load.
        Returns:
        A patient or caregiver object built from the userID.
        Throws:
        NoSuchUserException - Thrown if there is no user with the given userID in the database.
        android.accounts.NetworkErrorException - Thrown if app is unable to reach Elasticsearch server.

      • saveUser

        public void saveUser(User user)
        Take the data in the given user object, deconstructs it and queues it up for upload. If internet is available, also uploads all changes from queue to Elasticsearch.
        Parameters:
        user - The user object to be synced into the database.

      • deleteUser

        public void deleteUser(java.lang.String userID)
                throws NoSuchUserException,
                       android.accounts.NetworkErrorException
        Delete all data belonging to the user associated with the given userID from the database. Does not delete patients of caregiver when caregiver is deleted.
        Parameters:
        userID - The userID of the user to be cleared out.
        Throws:
        NoSuchUserException
        android.accounts.NetworkErrorException
